byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH

abstract: Ramapo, NY, Supervisor Christopher St Lawrence is arrested in connection with federal securities fraud case involving financing of Provident Bank Park baseball stadium, local minor-league team facility; St Lawrence is accused of using public money to fund half of stadium's $58 million cost, against clear wishes of town's voters.
lead_paragraph: Christopher St. Lawrence, the supervisor of the town in Rockland County, N.Y., was charged in a case that stems from the financing of a local minor-league baseball stadium.

headline.main: Ramapo Town Supervisor Arrested in Federal Fraud Case
headline.print_headline: Ramapo Official Charged in Securities Fraud Case

snippet: Christopher St. Lawrence, the supervisor of the town in Rockland County, N.Y., was charged in a case that stems from the financing of a local minor-league baseball stadium.
